title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: What is the LCD (largest common denominator) of $$\frac{3}{4}$$, $$\frac{3}{8}$$, and $$\frac{-1}{2}$$?

title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: We must now multiply both sides of the equation by the LCD. We now have $$8a+\frac{8\times3}{4}=\frac{8\times3}{8} a-\frac{8\times1}{2}$$. This simplifies to $$8a+6=3a-4$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To solve this equation, we must isolate the "a" term.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To isolate the "a" term, we can begin by subtracting 3a from both sides of the equation. We now have $$5a+6=-4$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: Now, we must subtract 6 from both sides so that only the "a" term is on the left-hand side. We now get $$5a=-10$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: Finally, we can divide both sides by 5 to get the "a" term by itself on the left-hand side. What is the value of a?
